result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick K. McMichael

records.addlTxt:
8:34 AM Defendant Patrick K. McMichael appeared by phone from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Patrick K. McMichael.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed with Deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Requests prelim.
Deft waives time limits.
Court schedules with parties.
Atty Spansail to decide if the prelim will be a waiver by October 28th so that the writ could be cancelled.
8:38 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:47 AM Defendant Patrick K. McMichael appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard.
Has contacted the PD, but has not had a response yet.
Deft to reach out to the Public Defender again today.
Court schedules with parties.
8:49 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:20 AM Defendant Patrick K. McMichael appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Deft understands charges and max penalties.
Court inquires on Atty.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Spansail heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $5,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, w/o a valid Rx.
Court schedules with parties.
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
9:23 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
